meanings.definition: Tiny specks of dirt or waste left behind by flies.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen table was covered in flyspecks from the pesky flies.
meanings.sent2: I had to clean the window to get rid of the annoying flyspecks.
meanings.sent3: The flyspecks on the wall looked like a tiny constellation of stars.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was so dirty, it was as if she wore flyspecks as a pattern.
meanings.sent5: The flyspecks on the ceiling stood out like little black dots against the white paint.

meanings.definition: A small, insignificant or trivial detail.
meanings.sent1: Don't worry about the flyspecks in your presentation; focus on the main points.
meanings.sent2: He tends to get caught up in the flyspecks and misses the bigger picture.
meanings.sent3: Arguing over the flyspecks of the plan was pointless when the main goal was clear.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't see the forest for the trees, getting lost in the flyspecks of the issue.
meanings.sent5: The flyspecks of the story added a touch of realism to the overall narrative.
